SEARCH
Package server.Controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
server.Controller.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
This Class is the controller for the GameModel and also for the GameBoardController. It also has a bind with the RemoteServer that runs the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(GameModel game)
      Creates an instance of GameController binding it with GameModel which is the main Class of the Model of the Game. Also creates a new GameBoardController.
      Parameters:
      game - the instance of GameController to bind

  • Method Details

    • getGame

      public GameModel getGame()
      Returns:
      the controlled GameModel

    • setFull

      public void setFull()
      Sets to true the variable full of the GameController

    • getGameBoardController

      public GameBoardController getGameBoardController()
      Returns:
      the corresponding GameBoardController

    • initGameBoard

      public void initGameBoard()
      Method called when the number of Players has reached the requested number. Creates a GameBoard, binds it with a LivingRoom and sets the CommonGoals for the game.

    • pickTile

      public TileReplyMessage pickTile(int x, int y)
      Method to pick a PlayableItemTile from the LivingRoom
      Parameters:
      x - the 'x' position of the PlayableItemTile to pick
      y - the 'y' position of the PlayableItemTile to pick
      Returns:
      a TileReplyMessage containing the results of the procedure. The results could be the following: (1) if the field tile in TileReplyMessage is null the procedure failed: if the field PickTileResponse in TileReplyMessage is MAX_TILE_PICKED it means that the Player has already picked the maximum number of PlayableItemTiles for this turn, otherwise if the field PickTileResponse in TileReplyMessage is INVALID_TILE it means that the Player tried to pick an invalid ItemTile and the pick procedure needs to be redone. (2) if the field tile in TileReplyMessage is not null the procedure has been completed correctly.

    • putTile

      public InsertionReplyMessage putTile(int xPos, int yPos, PlayableItemTile selectedTile, int numOfTilesOnPutting)
      Method to put the first PlayableItemTile in the Shelf
      Parameters:
      xPos - the 'x' position of the PlayableItemTile to put
      yPos - the 'y' position of the PlayableItemTile to put
      selectedTile - the PlayableItemTile to put
      numOfTilesOnPutting - the number of PlayableItemTiles to put during this turn
      Returns:
      a InsertionReplyMessage containing the results of the procedure. The results could be the following: (1) if the field isValid is false then the procedure has failed. (2) if the field isValid is true the procedure has been successful.

    • putTile

      public InsertionReplyMessage putTile(int xPos, PlayableItemTile selectedTile, int numOfTilesOnPutting)
      Method to put the next PlayableItemTiles in the Shelf
      Parameters:
      xPos - the 'x' position of the PlayableItemTile to put
      selectedTile - the PlayableItemTile to put
      numOfTilesOnPutting - the number of PlayableItemTiles to put during this turn
      Returns:
      a InsertionReplyMessage containing the results of the procedure. The results could be the following: (1) if the field isValid is false then the procedure has failed. (2) if the field isValid is true the procedure has been successful.

    • nextTurn

      public void nextTurn()
      Method that determines the beginning of a new game turn and sets the new currPlayer

    • CalculateWinner

      public void CalculateWinner(ArrayList<Player> playerArrayList)
      Method that determines the winner of the game and sets the new matchWinner. The winner is the Player with more points. If there is more than one Player with the highest total of points they are put in an ArrayList, the method chooses from this ArrayList the matchWinner by finding the farthest Player from the chairOwner according to the order in which the Players are inside the playerArrayList.
      Parameters:
      playerArrayList - the ArrayList of the Players in the game

    • findAdjGroups

      public static HashMap<Colour,ArrayList<Integer>> findAdjGroups(PlayableItemTile[][] shelf)
      Static method to find the dimensions of the groups of adjacent PlayableItemTiles of the same Colour in the Shelf
      Parameters:
      shelf - the Shelf on which the method will search the groups of adjacent PlayableItemTiles
      Returns:
      an Hashmap in which the keys are the possible Colours of the PlayableItemTiles and the elements associated to the keys, which are stored in ArrayLists, are counters which indicates the size of the group/groups of adjacent PlayableItemTiles

    • findAdjGroupDim

      private static int findAdjGroupDim(PlayableItemTile[][] structure, boolean[][] visited, int i, int j, Colour colour, ArrayList<Integer> dimension)

    • AddAdjacencyPoint

      private Integer AddAdjacencyPoint(HashMap<Colour,ArrayList<Integer>> adjacencyGroups)

    • calculatePoint

      public void calculatePoint(Player player, LivingRoom livingRoom)
      This method computes the new amount of points to award to a Player. The checks are done on the completion status of the Player PersonalGoal, of the CommonGoals and of the presence of groups of adjacent PlayableItemTiles of the same Colour.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player to whom the points will be awarded
      livingRoom - the LivingRoom on which the checks will be made

    • addPoint

      public Integer addPoint(CommonGoal commonGoal)
      Parameters:
      commonGoal - the CommonGoal which has been completed
      Returns:
      the amount of points awarded to the Player that has completed it. This value depends on the number of Players that already completed such CommonGoal.
